description: A round-up of the latest Cymru Premier action.
title: Cymru Premier: TNS remain top after 100th minute winner
title_page: Cymru Premier: TNS remain top after 100th minute winner - BBC Sport
maintext:
Friday, 3 January
Bala Town P-P Caernarfon Town: The rearranged contest between the Lakesiders and the Canaries was postponed due to a frozen pitch at Maes Tegid.
Saturday, 4 January
Haverfordwest County 5-1 Briton Ferry Llansawel: Haverfordwest made the perfect start to 2025 as they came from a goal down to hammer Briton Ferry. Tom Walters had given the visitors the lead after 40 minutes, but Haverfordwest were level before half-time thanks to Ben Ahmun's goal. And the hosts dominated the second half, as Ahmun, Greg Walters, Owain Jones and Rhys Abbruzzese all scored in the space of 12 minutes. Haverfordwest remain third with victory, while Briton Ferry stay just one place above bottom-side Aberystwyth.
The New Saints 2-1 Newtown: The New Saints scored a 100th minute winner to remain top of the Cymru Premier and deny Newtown a valuable point away from home. Jason Oswell had put Newtown ahead in the second minute of the game, and they lead for over an hour at Park Hall. Aramide Oteh levelled things up with just over 25 minutes left to play before deep into stoppage time Josh Pask scored the winner.
